壽險 [ shòu xiǎn ]: life insurance; abbr. for 人寿保险

heisig_chinese_memo: A samurai wearing a broken crown works together an inch-thick floor under which to hide with his mouth glued (silent), giving him longevity as his enemies failed to find him.
Ru_trainchinese: shòu: (графема) долголетие; возраст; день рождения (пожилого человека); (эвфемизм) похоронный, погребальный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the samurai (士) does one (一) work (工) with his one mouth (口) to turn an inch (寸) of life into longevity
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This old China man glued shrubs to his body. The added intake of oxygen from the shrubs was, according to him, the secret of his longevity. Sometimes he would sit all day in meditation without moving, and the locals believed the old man had actually turned into a shrub !
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from the " old " province, " 𠃬 " sound. The original meaning is old age and longevity. "Said Wen": "𦓃 (shou), long time. From the old province, 𠷎 sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Extension is long, this is the meaning of long."

Bronze inscriptions express life and years, chanting Ding: "Ten thousand years (Mi) longevity", which means full life like ten thousand years. The second sentence: "Pray for longevity." It also means old age and longevity, 𦅫镈: "Pray for longevity (without death)", which means pray for long life and not die. He also said that for the elderly, Yu Ding: "Don't leave out the young." It means not to miss the elderly and children.

The Warring States period indicates life span, "Tsinghua Jane One. "Qi Ye" Jane 9: "Wan Shou Die (Wu) Jiang", which means that the life span is as long as eternal life, without end.

" Shou " in Han silk script means life span. "Mawangdui. "Health Prescription" line 151: "Yilong", which means longevity. "Mawangdui. "Ten Questions" Jane 101: "Life can be found in the sun and the moon", that is, the same life as the sun and the moon, meaning that the life span is as long as the sun and the moon. "Zhuangzi. Zaiyou: "I am with the sun and the moon, and I am with the heaven and the earth."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from the " old " province, " 𠃬 " sound. The original meaning is old age and longevity.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「老」省，「𠃬」聲。本義是年老、長壽。《說文》：「𦓃(壽)，久也。从老省，𠷎聲。」段玉裁注：「引伸爲長久，此用長久之義也。」

　　金文表示壽命、年歲，頌鼎：「萬年沬(彌)壽」，意謂如萬年般滿壽。其次句鑃：「用祈萬壽」。又表示年老、長壽，𦅫鎛：「用祈壽老母(毋)死」，意謂祈求長命，不要死亡。又表示老人，禹鼎：「勿遺壽幼」，意指不要遺漏老人和小孩。

　　戰國文字表示壽命，《清華簡一．耆夜》簡9：「萬壽亡(無)疆」，意謂壽命如萬世般長久，沒有止境。

　　漢帛書「壽」表示壽命。《馬王堆．養生方》第151行：「益壽」，意指增壽。《馬王堆．十問》簡101：「壽參日月」，即與日月同壽，指壽命如日月般長久。《莊子．在宥》：「吾與日月參光，吾與天地為常。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「老」省，「𠃬」聲。本義是年老、長壽。

壽字的基本解释

壽
shòu
见“寿”。

壽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shòu］
［《廣韻》承呪切，去宥，禪。］
［《廣韻》殖酉切，上有，禪。］
亦作“夀1”。“寿1”的繁体字。
(1)年寿；寿限。亦指事物的使用期限。
(2)引申指年，岁。
(3)生日。
(4)长寿；活得岁数大。
(5)指使之长寿。
(6)祝寿；祝福。多指奉酒祝人长寿。
(7)引申指问候。
(8)谓以颂寿名义赠人金帛。
(9)婉辞。生前预备的；装殓死人的。如寿木；寿材；寿衣。
(10)保全。
(11)久远；使之久远。
(12)镌刻，镌镂。谓使之长远留存。
(13)方言。傻，不通世故人情。参见“壽頭”。
(14)姓。

壽字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【士字部】　壽； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页244第04
〔古文〕????【唐韻】【集韻】?承咒切，音綬。【說文】久也。凡年齒皆曰壽。【書·君奭】天壽平格。【詩·大雅】作召公考，天子萬壽。【左傳·僖三十二年】爾何知，中壽。【註】上壽百二十歲，中壽百歲，下壽八十。【董子繁露】壽者，酬也。壽有短長，由養有得失。【前漢·王吉傳】心有堯舜之志，則體有松喬之壽。　又以金帛贈人曰壽。【史記·刺客傳】嚴仲子奉。黃金百鎰，爲聶政母壽。　又星名。【爾雅·釋天】壽星，角亢也。【註】數起角亢，列宿之長，故曰壽。　又地名。平壽，衞下邑。【左傳·昭二十年】衞侯在平壽，壽州古淮南，春秋吳楚?蔡之地，戰國倂于楚，考烈王遷此，曰郢都。靈壽，古中山邑。【史記·魏世家】樂羊拔中山，文侯封之靈壽。　又漢壽，亭名，在蜀嚴道。曹操以關羽爲漢壽亭侯。　又山名。【史記·五帝紀】舜作什器于壽山。又壽山在福州侯官縣，產文石，可爲印章，五色具備，惟艾綠色者少。【宋·黃幹詩】石爲文多招斧鑿。又水名。壽水，在太原壽陽縣，其源有二，一出要羅村，一出頡訖村，合流

壽字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
壽字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
life
shòu

life
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shòu］
["Guangyun" undertakes cutting, going to you, and Zen. ]
["Guangyun" reproduces unitary cuts, there is on it, Zen. ]
Also known as "Shou 1". Traditional characters for "寿1".
(1) Years of life; life limit. It also refers to the useful life of things.
(2) Extended refers to years and years.
(3) Birthday.
(4) Longevity; live to be old.
(5) Instruct it to live longer.
(6) Birthday; blessings. Refers to serving wine to wish people longevity.
(7) Extended refers to greetings.
(8) It is said that Jinbo was given to people in the name of Songshou.
(9) Euphemism. Prepared before death; pretending to be death. Such as longevity wood; longevity wood; shroud.
(10) Preservation.
(11) To be far away; to make it far away.
(12) Engraving and engraving. That is to make it last for a long time.
(13) Dialects. Stupid, unreasonable. See "Shoutou".
(14) Last name.
life

[Note] First life is one hundred and twenty years old, middle life is one hundred years old, and next life is eighty years old. [Dong Zifanlu] Those who live longevity are rewarded. There are short and long life, and there are gains and losses from raising. [Historical Records·Assassin's Biography] Yan Zhongzifeng. Golden Bai Yi, longevity for Nie Zheng's mother.　Also star name. [Erya·Shitian] Longevity star, Jiao Kang also. 【Note】Several angles are overwhelming, and the rows are long, so it is called longevity.　Also place name. Pingshou, Weixiayi. The land of Cai, the Warring States Period was surpassed in Chu, King Kaolie moved here, and it was called the capital of Ying. Lingshou, ancient Zhongshan Town. Shoushan is in Houguan County, Fuzhou. It produces aragonite, which can be used as a seal. [Song·Huang Qianshi] Stone is a weapon for Wendu. Also known as water.
